result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy W Starkey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety. 

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended.  AODA and follow up. 

SAFE program and follow up. 

Participate in and comply with Marathon County Probation Review Hearings. 

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Probation review hearing on December 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Case Called: 3:27 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Vanessa Avila in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property-Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, SAFE Program and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Participate in and Comply with the Marathon County Probation Review Hearings, I/S 15 Hours of Community Service to be used for rule violations, I/S 15 Days MCJ to be used for rule violations, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 

DATES:
Probation Review Hearing 12/02/2022 @ 1:15 pm

Adjourned: 3:40 pm
Jury status hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
